name: Hen-Of-The-Woods With Black Bean Sauce
keywords: dairy-free, fermented black beans, hen of the woods mushroom, red bell pepper, side dish
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons fermented black beans, rinsed and finely chopped
2 small red bell peppers, cut into 1/2-inch strips

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the base of the hen-of-the-woods and discard. Rinse the mushrooms under cool, running water. Slice them lengthwise into 1/2-inch strips, then put them into a saucepan. Cover the pan and, without adding any water, braise the mushroom pieces over medium-low heat until they release their water and can be pierced easily with a fork, about five to seven minutes. (Check the pan after two or three minutes and, if it is dry, add one-half cup of water.) Take off the lid, turn the heat up to high and cook until all the water has evaporated. Remove from heat.

Pour the oil into a large skillet and turn the heat up to high, then add the black beans, garlic and ginger. Stir-fry for 15 to 30 seconds or until the ingredients are fragrant. Add the mushrooms, peppers and onion and continue to stir-fry for one to two minutes or until the vegetables begin to soften.
Add the stock and soy sauce and bring to a boil. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and cold water. Stir this mixture into the skillet, and when the sauce thickens, remove from heat and serve.
